{"step_by_step_thinking": "Radical neck dissection involves the en masse removal of all tissue elements in the space between the subdermis and the fascia colli. The technique emphasizes the removal of the cervical lymph system with its lymph nodes and afferent and efferent connecting vessels. According to the description, the essential portion of this large mass of tissue is the cervical lymph system. This information suggests that the internal jugular vein would not be removed in radical neck dissection as it is an important blood vessel. Therefore, option D: Internal Jugular Vein is not removed in radical neck dissection.", "answer_choice": "D"}
